bow: housework is so overwhelming getting depressed every morning when wake up it just automatically bad day and know it could be worse but hear me out the first thing usually see is dishes left on the floor by my fiance or empty beer bottles trash etc he leaves for work super early in the morning like am and works til the afternoon get it he works lot but do think its fair to pick up after him all the time ok not all the time maybe once week he picks up our bedroom but that it asked him to do one chore days ago and guess who is getting ready to do that today the worst part is waste all morning cleaning and cooking and all afternoon do get to really play with the kids as much as like by the time done with everything have to go to work and he gets to come home and the only thing he does is heat up the dinner made them change diaper and brush their teeth if work short shift get to come home and do this too we are blessed that we have family that takes the kids on weekends takes them boating swimming to church etc because work 10+ hour days on the weekends and the family loves seeing them it sucks that never really get day off either taking care of the kids and then going to work or working all day know probably pissing off lot of stay at home or single moms this probably sounds like first world problems to you guys and sorry it just makes me sad that on weekends when they re not here he is off work but does do much except see his friends and relax which he is entitled to do but it would be great if he could cross couple things off my to do list while gone and like said get it he works lot but do too am starting to feel kind of worthless should be able to handle all this did great as single mom but when have someone here who should be sharing the responsibility and is have to ask myself what doing wrong and why he does think need break it getting harder and harder to just get out of bed because my life is constant work no breaks except to browse reddit on my phone while cooking or whatever and nothing to show for it as far as having good time with the kids when we talk about it he gets all mad and tells me he tired tired too but guess that does matter sorry for the wall of text any advice would be appreciated thanks for reading most people know have deal you split up the chores according to who works most if he works 25 more than you you do 25 more of the chores if it equal you split them equally it is completely unfair for you to do everything if you are also working have you talked to him about it without nagging start out easy know you work lot and the last thing you want to do when you come home is clean but not in much of different position and really want and need more of your help definitely say something to him but use sentences feel like having to do large majority of the house work feel like not able to play with the kids as much as want and it makes me really sad whatever you can come up with that does make it seem like you re blaming him suggest making chore chart or something similar that shows everything that needs to be cleaned on daily weekly and monthly basis if it helps point out the things you do regularly compared to the things he does regularly on the chart sometimes visual aid like that will help him realize that you re doing more than your fair share good luck deleted second this you need to talk to him without blaming him that wo get you anywhere but fightsville but you should keep it to yourself because it ll just eat you up until you explode at him one day started leaving the messes made out of laziness by my husband and kids when they got home from work school id let them know what needed to be done they got better at cleaning up after themselves after realizing how much easier itd be to put their clothes in the hamper throw trash away put dishes in the dishwasher put toys away etc as soon as they were finished have no problems doing laundry vacuuming making dinner but im not their personal maid you shouldnt be either edit and housewife it just disrespectful to leave messes you could easily clean up yourself when he comes home from work is the kitchen cleaned aka does he need to clean up after you if the answer is no then think the two of you should institute new rule that he cleans up his mess before he goes to bed you should have to spend all morning cleaning up from the night before also you should consider having him cook dinner at least few nights week you could still go grocery shopping and leave out certain items for him like if he making spaghetti with meat sauce for dinner you could make sure the meat is defrosted and the sauce and noodles are easily accessible for him additionally you could start doing some crock pot meals that take very little effort to cook on the weekends you should talk about how together you will each spend hours cleaning doing chores together maybe few days week when he gets home from work he could throw load of laundry in and just do one complete load of laundry when you only have to do one load its not that hard someone else suggested writing down all of the chores that you guys do need to do and then figure out plan for the two of you to tackle them together my husband takes out the trash and does laundry about once month he gives me attitude if ask him to pick up the cloths he just tossed on the floor for me to pick up hate this also hate him leaving dishes for me to clean up you are grown man yes you work all day but it is going to kill you to put the damn thing in the sink thank you for the rant moment perhaps he does realize it causing you to feel so stressed out after speaking to him about how much extra work it is on top of your other tasks at home then consider this as possible solution for him and maybe you too it kinda based on the pomodoro timer thing but it little more flexible first set timer for 20 to 30 minutes and do as much pick up and clean up as you can in that amount of time try not to get distracted but if you do answer the door take phone call visit the restroom pause the timer do forget to restart it when you get back to cleaning when the timer goes off take break now maybe you might organize your day doing something like that and he might set the timer when he gets home before he does other tasks or takes nap consider asking him to take on certain parts of the house such as the living room to make sure it at least picked up or items are consolidated to make it easier for you to clean in the mornings thanks may try the timer method tell him that he should do things before he takes nap but he just tells me he is unable am get work done then relax person and he is it will get done when it gets done person but it never gets done never nag really just get frustrated work around 40 hours week not counting the time with the kids also starting school in january he works around 50 hours week so its pretty close how would you divide this up for us ve blown up couple times out of him not listening to me my feel statements work sometimes but after he agrees to do things he just does do them make lists where split up our work but end up doing most of his also while he is playing game because it needs to get done thank you ll have just picked up millions of clothes off the floor because somehow laundry baskets randomly explode sometimes guess he will come home and leave his dirty clothes on the floor say really and he goes leave them there so know to wear them tomorrow ugh put them on shelf or something this is interesting how old are your kids would this work on preschoolers have to bribe my daughter to help me clean and my son ignores me also split it up according to what he says he will do do just order him around did want it to sound like that is it feasible for you to hire some help housecleaner to come once week or once every two weeks get it if it not it not for us right now but when it is man it helps me out good luck wow felt like you wrote this for me similar situation at our house and it drives me mad he does help every once in while and wants cookie for it but seems completely oblivious to the fact that there are things that need to be done on constant daily basis cleaning the kitchen by yourself once month does make up for the dishwashing and counter cleaning ve been doing every day same with laundry the living room floor the playroom etc if he at least cleaned up after himself would mind so much but as it is now it like having third child never sure if should talk about it be good role model clean around his messes or what nothing seems to work and it really does make me feel completely overwhelmed resentful and depressed that being said thanks to everyone for the good advice here sounds like you need break is there any way the kids can help with the chores or maybe you can ask your family to take kids on weekday and let him take them for part of the weekend so you have day we must be twin souls in the mom world lol have those exact feelings too it good to know we are alone and am so grateful for all the advice here as well that would be great am trying to cut bad habits cigarettes makeup buy and never wear to save some money maybe we could put some extra cash towards this thanks sometimes get my daughter to take dishes downstairs for candy but feel bad it not her job she picks up her toys brother drags them back out she gets frustrated like me asher just cleaned lol just wanted to say thanks for all the helpful advice and sharing similar stories will devise plan and hopefully get to talk to him about it tonight before work or tomorrow thanks again definitely the latter but realized since no one else out there is doing this stuff for me single mom then have to buckle down when have the time maybe he can start small 15 minutes and work up to longer time 30 minutes also help him know what the priority should be maybe putting dishes in the sink or moving clean dishes to the proper place or just throwing away trash and putting dirty clothes in the basket from there he will see what else needs to be done oh that great game every time you want to buy cigarettes or makeup or whatever stop yourself and put that money in jar as soon as you have enough hire some help our housecleaner is around 100 cleaning 1250 sq feet beds baths in chicago also she bit above average she uses all green environmentally friendly dog+kid safe stuff unless you live in ny or san francisco it should be less for you hope would try to be as diplomatic and straightforward as possible what chores do you feel you can handle when you come home from work do mind vacuuming or picking up the kids toys ill volunteer to do that how does putting the laundry away and emptying the dishwasher every other night sound make it collaborative effort let him feel like he is choosing do even bring up the words unfair or slacking etc good luck to ya do get too down on yourself it sounds like you re an awesome mom who is busting her butt to help provide by the way how old are your kiddos can they help with any chores yet helping push the broom around put their own toys away thank you ll try to be nicer when ask maybe just asking wrong never thought of it like that my kids are and my year old is in the same boat as me she picks up after her brother and gets mad at him lol it okay because he going to learn to rake care of himself here soon hmm maybe not showing him enough appreciation when he does things thank you admire you single moms so much did it for bit and it was rough and will try this thanks such great idea live in ohio so ca imagine it being too much of price difference and that is too steep this is going to sound really stupid but we live in townhouse it like bedrooms upstairs kitchen and living room downstairs and basement are the cleaning people going to make me feel bad because am overwhelmed with such small area one thing that might help this particular case is to put chair where he usually puts his clothes and tell him that chair is specifically for his clothes so that he knows exactly where they are my husband used to put his keys wallet and glasses on the kitchen table every day but now that he has bowl for pocket stuff it stays there you said you did better as single mom are the kids yours only or is one of them both of yours perhaps he feels it is his responsibility to be cleaning up after your kids do say this rudely but as matter of point he may feel like it is your responsibility to be doing it because they are his this is great idea have basket for wallets and keys its useful once you get into the habit thanks oh my gosh no you work and have baby that would be overwhelming if you lived in shoebox plus lots of people have help just because they choose to sure there will be zero judgment do think you re brig rude at all this is valid point my daughter is not his but he has taken to being her father perfectly did expect him to take care of her really maybe the problem is that when we had our son he had to help more he was working so he did all the night time feedings and diaperings when the baby came along so could go back to work weeks later now the kids are easier but the messes are maybe he overwhelmed also did not consider this thank you this made me feel so much better thank you it not the space it the life inside it smaller spaces are hard because you have to have all of it available to live in so someone always says this in every thread but just do get how it helps anyone my problem is not the mopping or vacuuming or whatever it the clutter toys and general pick up maid services do do this and often wo even clean around it need to clean before maid even came in the door and what services they do offer are like the 15 minute non problem part of housework for me does anyone do this does it really feel like it helps we as moms tend to be super heroes and parenting household issues often seem more straight forward to us know with my partner dishes in the sink and over flowing laundry baskets bother me long before they bother him so in his line of thinking he is truly aware that these things are bothering me and is actually ignoring the messes he just figures when they get out of hand he will pick them up it always bothers me before it gets to that point though so always feel like am doing all of the cleaning but he is trying to put that all on my shoulders really our service does it all including picking up all the clutter that was part of the consultation where everything goes toys dishes clothes all of it they also do all our laundry including linens also remember you are their client they do care why you hired them they re probably just happy that you did hope it helps it should be her job though or at least starting to be try asking the awesome folks in parenting so you do have similar kind of conversation when she older wow maybe need to call around more well in addition to getting rid of crap of course it was always like that for my mom too we tried but it usually just ended with us piling everything on our beds just so someone else could come vacuum now know game play involves penalizing my trips to the grocery store to avoid frivolous shopping whenever make trip *always* withdraw 20 bucks at checkout whether there for the big haul or quick trip for milk when get home deposit the money into my petty cash piggy bank ve been doing this for about months and have close to 400 dollars in there which is nice for surprise household expenses like plumbing or the washing machine going kaput you are in chicago are you if so have company to recommend will say they are bit more expensive than others ve used but they do all above use all environmentally dog+baby friendly cleaners and do great job so for me it worth it find out what jobs he hates and what he can tolerate doing same goes for you sit down with pad of paper and divide up the chores with him he hates dishes you offer to do them you hate cleaning the tub he gets to everything else just divide it up according to whatever system works for you typically have my husband do the toilets and the trash and do most everything else as stay home mom if worked would also assign him the floors incl vacuuming and mopping the rest of the bathroom and the computer desks you re totally right letting them feel like they are choosing works wonders made list of everything that needs to get done on daily weekly monthly basis and he got to pick out which chores became his chores it worked much better than when told him what to do he kind of pain about taking orders may be home all day but that does mean he exempt from all housework and and months yeah it keeps them from playing if they have to clean up their old messes we also take out one thing at time and all their toys are in common area instead of in their room ive found that helps tremendously with messes they even put their dishes in the dishwasher now cleaning people are happy to be cleaning because they are getting money for it you are actually helping your local economy by working with cleaning person the way that it helps is they come in and even if they just do the bathroom kitchen and general tidy every two weeks that is perfectly clean house you have for like an hour every two weeks and then you can kind of ignore the bathroom for few days barring any bathroom drama or just wipe down toilet and sink which only takes second there are few jobs that are never finished not matter how much you do them dishes and laundry maybe you can talk to your fiance about taking responsibility for one of these things every day like set it up that he washes the dishes every evening yeah its hard but parenting is hard yeah he tired but every parent is tired its just part of life it seems like he is responding to just jumping in and helping but maybe if you helped him have some structure and routine to it he do better or maybe he has terrible attitude in which case do know what to tell you good luck edit fixed confusing wording do know if this has been said yet did read all comments sorry had hard time with this with my husband for years finally started giving him choices he said he ca read my mind and for some reason he does notice that the garbage needs to go out will ask him do you want to change the baby diaper or take the garbage out do you want to take care of child or put groceries away do you want to vacuum the floor or do the dishwasher think it makes him feel like he has choice even though know which one he will make kind of steering him in the right direction also do not like to nag we worked out that if give him choice he is more likely to willingly help know how you feel about the housework am stay at home mom and babysit from home it does get overwhelming at times am mom to two college aged kids have done the stay at home mom thing the single working mom thing and the remarried with kids thing first please know that you are in the most labor intensive stage of child rearing that there is ages and that is so tough but the good news is that it gets easier and easier especially if you get your kids involved early learning how to do simple household tasks and know it seems hard to believe now but the time really does go so fast before you know it they will be off to college and you will miss the days when cleaning and cooking gave you something to do because cleaning and cooking for just two adults who work full time only requires few minutes day second what helped me *immensely* back then was recognizing that the one that wants the house clean the most is the one that does the cleaning there no reason to resent if the other is pulling the weight they just do care as much as you or might do love clean house tried the go on strike thing and that worked to certain extent the hubby would eventually pick up the slack on the chores that mattered the most to him so for example the laundry got done the trash went out but the dishes did not get done and certainly the baseboards and floors did not get cleaned it may not seem fair but it is what it is put two people together and they are not going to agree completely on level of cleanliness one will become the neat freak and the other the slob that how it works you can try to meet in the middle you work on not caring so much about crumbs while he works on caring slightly more but this does work for very long the best solution just accepting that you care about crumbs so you get to clean them without resentment if he was in your life if you were single mom you be cleaning them yourself anyway would you and if the answer is no then why are you cleaning them now go have sex instead tl dr if you want the house clean clean it yourself and let go of resentment or expectation unless of course you can afford housecleaning service highly recommend that it has saved more than one marriage and hang in there it really does get better this works with our almost year old as well whatever you decide in terms of hiring cleaner just want to add that your happiness is more important than the toys on the floor hiring someone to do that for you might be the solution or it might be something else but you must come first and whatever you tell yourself in your dark moments is all bull shit you re great mom and you re doing fucking awesome job looking up to you this post makes so much sense and made me chuckle thank you months you ve got your hands full tell me about it theyre pretty good just have to stay on top of them and be consistent we have pretty calm home most of the time and loooove it im so lucky our parenting methods have worked out so far we have run into plenty of snags and im sure there will be many more but it couldve been much more tumultuous ride also if the kids ignore requests to clean up messes we give an extra chore or just throw out the toys they left out praise the pants off of our preschooler for helping and he likes doing it now we used to give allowance for helping out but that really didnt work so well so now they just clean up their own messes and do extra chores if they ignore basic responsibilities no one complains and theyre used to keeping things in order dont even have to tell them to clean up their toys most of the time but it took long time of staying on them about it seriously like months was about to evict them even my husband but now he occasionally makes comments on how nice it makes our home when everyone cleans up after themselves haha evicted them glad not the only one who has thought this and like this they have way too many toys anyways thanks my brother and never listened to our dad when he told us to do things because we knew that if we stalled or forgot about it long enough he just do it stop doing things for him it ll take while for the effects of that to wear off but they will eventually you just have to stay strong in the meantime and refuse to do anything more than your fair share and talk to him of course tell him you re not going to do it anymore etc this may be relevant to your interests
